Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alpinetours
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the And Hotel in Istanbul and with it's great location, we are happy with the service. This hotel is centrally located to The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace museum and Grand Bazaar with many other attractions close by. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be better placed than here”
Reviews.Author: StephHitH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the And Hotel 6 years ago and went back in April this year. The hotel had been refurbished since we were last there and there is now a coffee bar downstairs for breakfast and food throughout the day. On the top floor is a restaurant (open from midday) with panoramic views of the city and the food is good. This is not a luxury 5 star hotel and the rooms are bijou but it is clean and comfortable, the staff were friendly and it is in the most accessible position to view Istanbul. The hotel is next to the Hagia Sophia and opposite the cisterns; it is 2 minutes to the Blue Mosque and 5 to 10 minutes from Topkapi. The restaurant on the 6th floor has fabulous views over the golden horn and it's a great place to sit at one of the tables having a drink and taking in the city, We normally stay in really up market hotels but this one keeps calling for return trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “AND Hotel, Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sunnida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location to be for seeing all the sites, just steps from the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque. the Topkapi Palace and the cistern and right on the tram line. The rooms are small but very nice, and with views of Hagia Sophia. The staff is really attentive. The rooftop restaurant excellent and main floor cafe good for breakfast. Perfect for singles, families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, perfect location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Superkatt
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel fÃ¶r city-sightseeing. Top-floor restaurant with tasteful food and best panoramic view I have seen in istanbul. Bar/breakfast cafe on ground floor, elevator, luggage help, transfer to airport on request. Rooms, especially on upper floor have balkony and perfect view to H.Sofia and the rest of the city. Clean and comfortable. Thanks for the nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quant and centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: Molly S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the hotel with my friend while on vacation. The view from our room of Hagia Sophia was amazing, so make sure to ask to be on the east side of the building (facing front). The beds were standard twins, which might seem small if you are accustomed to larger beds and the rooms are small. However, the staff is pleasant, there is plenty of hot water, and you are smack in the perfect location to explore old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: clare7688
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this hotel it was good value for money it was clean decor was ok if a bit dated but a good 3 star staff were helpful and friendly and it was a great central location beside haggia sofia and the blue mosque. We didnt get up early enough for breakfast we just ate out nearby and you have a lot to choose from. Istanbul is more expensive from other seaside resorts ive visited, we did the blue tour bus which was 15 euros each it took about 3 hours but gave you a good overview of the old city. We went to the Grand Bazaar which was busy I had to stop myself buying anything but some nice gold and handbags. We passed the american bazaar which is near where the cruise ships are I wish I had of known about this before I went as I would have shopped there. All in all good and I would come back to this very old city steeped in history.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was good but expected a little more.”
Reviews.Author: Rezakbari
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was good. But should provide more value for the money charged. No WIFI in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “And hotel”
Reviews.Author: fc_2002
Reviews.Content: Very good and clean rooms. Very helpfull and freindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Magical location, excellent rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: dolores12333
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the And Hotel in 1994 while traveling with a group of friends and we have we have stayed there since whenever we are fortunate enough to return to Istanbul. We were just there two days ago and the upgrades made our stay even more comfortable: very clean room, great bath, lots of hot water, great heating, nice refridgerator, lots of English language channels on the TV, exceedingly comfortable bed and bedding, and a wonderful terrace facing the Aya Sofia (such a treat to fall asleep and wake-up to such a magical view!). Everything is incredibly accessible from the And, the terrace hotel has a panoramic view to remembered and lots of delicious foods, and breakfast is typically Turkish but offers a greater variety than most. Staff is always super polite, friendly, accessible, and helpful. We totally trust them. One year they learned that we were travelling (a group of five) along the Mediterranean up to Antalya by bus and they explained it would be more cost effective to hire a van. They helped us do so, and we not only saved money, but had a delightul driver and a very comfortable van--being able to stop everywhere we wanted to made it a very special time. This time it was only my husband and I, and although we had not been to the And in six years, the staff recognized us and made us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “The AND Hotel in Sultanahmet, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VANCOUVER8877
Reviews.Content: Having been to Turkey a few times now, and having experienced a few Istanbul hotels....I have to say after staying at The AND Hotel in Istanbul... I do not have to worry about looking for any other accommodation other than The AND Hotel, when I'm in Istanbul. Situated across from the Basilica Sistern as well as across the street from the Hagia Sophia makes it an excellent location. Not to mention the tram stop(s) are located around the corner. Rooms have breathtaking views of the Hagia Sophia. There is also a top notch roof top restaurant with a 360 degree view of the city. Very impressive reservation experience.. Having just emailed a reservation request - even with the time difference of 10 hours between Canada & Turkey, I immediately received a complete reply... with a followup telephone call - Mahmut was extremely pleasant and efficient with excellent English. I don't usually contribute reviews..but wanted to share the positive travel experiences in Istanbul that was greatly assisted by my experiences from the And Hotel team As

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location.”
Reviews.Author: CDR444
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start and end of a tour. The staff and friendly and helpful. The rooms are of a good size, however the bathrooms were a little small for my liking. Excellent location just across the road form Aya Sofia. There is an empty lot next door, and I would imagine that the views of Aya Sofia will be blocked with the site is developed. Decent turkish breakfast with some cereals to choose from also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Tina C
Reviews.Content: The And hotel was very comfortable and in a fantastic location to see so many things. The Blue Mosque was a stone's throw away and the view on that side of the hotel was superb! The staff was very friendly and had a good command of English. Breakfast was wonderful with many choices of hot and cold items. Afternoon tea was very nice as well. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AND HOTEL IS A MUST!”
Reviews.Author: janm1324
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the And Hotel for the first time over the new year. It was our first trip to Istanbul and after doing all the sightseeing which was wonderful we realised we couldn't have picked a better hotel for location and service. I can't really add anything new to the review which hasn't already been written as they all tell about the location which was perfect, you seriously couldn't get a better positioned hotel for all the sights and grand bizarre and the harbour. The staff were all wonderful and very helpful and friendly. The rooms were spotlessly clean, with clean towels etc daily. We will definitly be going back. Don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “1 Week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Abdo R
Reviews.Content: It was the first time for me in Istanbul and wasn't sure of the location and the hotel. After choosing AND Hotel and spending 7 days there, i was so glad that i made a good choice. location was perfect and in the middle of the touristic area, very nice view from the room of Hagia Sofia. Room was ok for a double room, it was clean and room service was done everyday. Only negative thing was breakfast in which there wasn't much choice. I think if i'm going to go again to Istanbul, AND would be the perfect place to be.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cindy V
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul at least twice a year. Since I discovered the AND Hotel, I don't stay anywhere else. This hotel does feel like home, the staff are very welcoming and friendly. The rooms are lovely and clean. The location and view simply cannot be beat. Sitting on the balcony of the restaurant during call to prayer is a highlight of any trip to Istanbul. You can see the Bosphorus, the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque at once. The call to prayer seems to begin at the Blue Mosque with other voices from the rest of the mosques joining in. It transports you. I would an frequently do recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Waking up with the Hagia Sophia in my window was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LiseHowe
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the AND hotel - The roof top deck was perfect. The location was better than perfect and the staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend the hotel for someone coming to Istanbul! The last morning that we were there involved an early morning dash to the airport. We woke up at 4:30 and as I looked out the window for one last moment with the Hagia Sophia silhouetted against the night, I was greeted by the start of the call to prayers - truly magical!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and location lift hotel above the pack”
Reviews.Author: OperaSydney
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. A stone's throw away from the Agia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, in the thick of the popular Sultanahmet district, the And Hotel has everything you need to get the most out of Istanbul. We stayed there twice - when we arrived in Istanbul at the beginning of September and at the end of September after touring western Turkey. The first time we had a room facing a wall. But it was quiet and we only used it to sleep. The second time we stayed there I requested a room with a view and we got a fantastic view. The hotel also has a roof top terrace - again with killer views - but I wouldn't recommend eating there when there are so many other options nearby. Staff were great and we relished the cheap and quick laundry service after a few weeks on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Briefly, my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalTourist12
Reviews.Content: How I regret that my first trip to Istanbul lasted only seven days! From the moment of my arrival, the And Hotel became my haven during that week of amazement and discovery. No matter how far I pushed the limits of my daily rambles, I knew that at the end I could retreat to comfort and safety. Staff, services, ambience, central location in Sultanahmet -- all as has been reported before. Top notch. I'll just add that seeing the gulls, lit from below, circling Agia Sofia and the Blue Mosque in the night sky -- right outside my window -- remains one of the most indescribably lovely sights of years and years of travel. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra C
Reviews.Content: All nice and helpful people. As I said, I felt like being at home,. The room was so nice, clean and cosy. I'll come back! And I can recommend it to anybody. Also the location is outstanding,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient, in a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn H
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel: neither too big nor too small, modern rooms in a traditional building with a bit of character, friendly and efficient staff, clean and comfortable. Free afternoon tea and biscuits was a typically nice touch. The breakfast buffet is Turkish-style, naturally enough, with plenty of different cheeses, olives and fresh tomatoes and cucumber as well as rolls, pastries, cereals etc. Personally I loved it! And although it's right in the heart of the old city it's a peaceful place to come back to after a day's exploring. Looking forward to staying there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent view Hagia Sophia”
Reviews.Author: Arno K
Reviews.Content: AND-Hotel is located with direct view to Hagia Sophia, just around the corner is the Blue Mosque, nevertheless very quiet. The beds are very good and the rooms are clean. The staff is very friendly and willing to help. If you get no room, try the restaurant with its wunderful roundview. The hotel has free wifi. I think the hotel offers good value for money. Quality of the breakfast-buffet is only 3 stars, but outstand good for turkey. If I go to Istanbul again, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very good beds, extremely friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MFvdB
Reviews.Content: The AND hotel is located just around the corner of the Blue Mosque, nevertheless quiet enough. The beds are very good and the rooms are clean. The staff is very friendly and willing to help: almost everything is possible (although not all of them speak sufficient english). The hotel has free wifi. I think the hotel offers good value for money: we (me and my two sons of 13 and 14 years old) payed EUR 140 per night for a 3-bed room. The only negative point: the quality of the breakfast buffet is included but only sort of ok (but good enough to survive). If I go to Istanbul again, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lily C C
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th time staying at The And Hotel and we are always happy to come back. The hotel is getting more nicer every time we come. The staffs are very nice, the food is very good. Splendid location just a short walking distance from The Hagia Sopia, The Blue Mosque, The Cistern and several other important historical sites. Also just a walking distant to the Grand Bazar. Nice view of The Golden Horn from the restaurant on the 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kveg10
Reviews.Content: Well-situated in the old city and conveniently located very near the main sites. Hotel staff speak English, are friendly and helpful. Rooms are on the small side, but bathrooms are spacious. Both are very clean and the room was very quiet, even during the start of the Ramazan festival.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great, safe location”
Reviews.Author: TravelTipsCalgary
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were very impressed by the prompt, friendly, courteous service received from Aydin , information officer at the Andâ€™s reception desk. Nothing was too much trouble for Aydin, who cheerfully exchanged our Euros for Turkish Lira, provided reliable directions and suggestions for excursions and helped us find a trustworthy local to help us navigate, translate and shop throughout the Grand Bazaar. As two 'directionally challenged' sisters travelling on our own, we really appreciated his help and sense of humour. As well, Aydin responded very promptly to questions e-mailed to the hotel prior to our departure. Our 3rd floor room was clean and comfortable with a lovely view of the Aga Sophia, especially at night. The 5th floor rooftop restaurant offered incredible views of the Sophia, Blue Mosque, Bosphorus Strait and the city of Istanbul. The And is well situated in the old part of the city, being a 5-minute walk to the Blue Mosque and close to the Grand Bazaar and Egyptian Spice Market. The food served in the 5th floor restaurant was excellent, as was the service. I highly recommend the And for its friendly, knowledgeable staff, cleanliness, decor, location, restaurant and amenities, including a room safe and comfortable, spacious reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NatouMelbourne
Reviews.Content: fabulous location, great rooms, some roomier than other but all very nice. Staff are very friendly and helfpul. Will go back without hesitation. Intrepid ERKP, Sep 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Small, charming hotel at great value”
Reviews.Author: Nancy P
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience with the hotel we chose on arrival in Istanbul and happened upon the AND. They had a charming room, clean, nicely decorated and actually far less expensive than our original choice. The staff was great and the rooftop restaurant was our favorite in Istanbul. We could walk to every major site and the views were extraordinary. The hotel made our visit perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: LKl_MOW Posted by an Oktogo.ru traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary week end and were absolutely charmed by this hotel. The rooms are very bright, clean, the bed is very comfortable. The best of the best - the view!!!! We stayed in the room facing Agya Sofia and the Blue Mosque - absolutely unforgettable. The staff int he hotel is very friendly and helpful, especially the gentelmen at the reception - thy gave us good advises on where to go. Definitely, a place to recommend - great location, great views, great staff !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but watch your laundry, your cosmetics AND your credit card!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkcrystal
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed in this hotel earlier this month. Great rooms, if you can try to get a room on the fifth floor with a balcony - excellent views of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. But but but, it's all politics with this hotel. Initially we stayed in June for 2 nights and clearly our tour operator pulled in a few favours and we had great accommodation which was instrumental in us booking our final 3 nights in Turkey at this hotel. However for this last stay, my 3 children were squashed into a room that in reality was barely a double room. The room I had with my husband had clearly been the venue for some or other cigar/chain-smoking party with the obligatory cherry pips still lying on the carpeted floor. According to the receptionist there were no rooms available for us to move. However the next morning miraculously a room (albeit a single room into which we squashed ourselves) appeared after I had expressed my outrage sufficienty (holidaying in Turkey is NOT relaxing as the entire trip is constantly up for negotiation despite having paid a tour operator copious amounts of money for a fully inclusive tour in the hope that one would be left in peace). Anyhow, with the move to the other room I left some of my cosmetics in the previous room - oh dear, "we simply can't find your items - perhaps the next guest took them" was how I was dismissed. I wouldn't use the laundry service either as several items of clothing went missing never to be seen again and the shirt of another poor soul was found in my laundry too. Upon making an enquiry at the front desk - "oh well, nothing to be done, your clothing is probably been worn by some or other Turkish person as we speak" was the joking comment I received. This kind of nonchalance I find a little out of line. And then to my disgust despite settling our bill for extras upon our departure and having paid the tour operator in full for the accommodation - the And Hotel had the nerve to bill my credit card for a goodly sum too - completely unfounded. Despite all this, the hotel is clean and very well located. Just all the other stuff that leaves a bad taste in my mouth. When I visit Turkey again, will make a point of NOT staying in this hotel purely because of the the sneakiness and slyness that surrounds all their transactions (not only here but I think it's inherent in Turkey - which is a pity as one hesitates to visit again).

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to be in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: turkeybooster
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with fantastic views of Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. It is across the street from the Cistern and around the corner from the Tram and many restaurants. Most of the major tourist sights are within easy walking distance and a park is being built directly in front of the hotel. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. The buffet breakfast is more than adequate in a city filled with great food. Recently, remodeled, the rooms are clean and modern. All the rooms at the front of the hotel face the Aya Sophia and some have balconies. The night-time view of the Aya Sophia is breath-taking. The location of the AND Hotel and the friendly, efficient staff are reason to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cozy hotel right next inthe cultural center Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: LeoliaN
Reviews.Content: Already second time coming to this place and very much enjoying the stay at this hotel. Central location, lots of restaurants around, souvenir shops, also the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque are just 2 min walk from the hotel. rooms very nice, although some of them might be very tiny but it doesnt spoil the impression. On top of the hotel got restaurant where it is very nice to have evening drink with fantastic view on blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location AND HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller01London
Reviews.Content: Our rooms on Level 5 had fantastic views of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia! It was great! The location of the hotel was also a great plus! We found it was so close to all the major attractions!! Fabulous hotel! The hotel staff also made our stay wonderful as they were courteous, helpful and friendly! They have a rooftop terrace restaurant on the 6th Floor where you can have food and drinks, but it is a little bit pricey. However, you have great panoramic views of the city! We only had drinks up there and it was a nice place to relax after a day of walking around the city in the sun. Our room was a little small but we were told it was because of the balcony we had. It wasn't much of a problem as were are not big people but if we were any taller, I think the space would have been a challenge. But we thought it was worth putting up with the smallness of the room, to be able to see the fantistic view!! Just a tip - We were in room 501 which I think is the smallest of the balcony rooms on Level 5. We used the airport transfer (provided by the hotel) from Ataturk airport, which ended up costing us 30Euros for two people!! Whilst others in our group had used Backpackers which costs 20TL for 4 people!!! We thought that was abit steep! However, when we used airport transfer from the hotel to Ataturk airport, it costs 10TL per person, total 20TL. Just a tip to be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location; wonderful views from balcony”
Reviews.Author: SeafarerRI
Reviews.Content: The AND Hotel is a six-story hotel that has been refurbished in the recent past. It's location is its greatest attraction; on a traffic-free side street in the traffic-controlled tourist center of Istanbul. Requesting a room with a panoramic view, such as my wife and I had, on the fifth floor, is the main reason for staying at the AND Hotel. Our room had a balcony that looked directly across at the Aya Sophia museum; built in Byzantine times as an enormous and richly decorated early Christian church, where Byzantine emperors were crowned. It then became the principal and monumental location of the Greek Orthodox church. During that era, exquisite mosaics and murals covered the walls and the dome. It became a mosque in the Islamic era of Istanbul, and is now a museum. Nearby, and very clearly visible from our balcony, was the monumental Sultanahmet (Blue) mosque; with six minarets. Both monuments are beautifully illuminated from dusk to dawn. There is an attractive restaurant and terrace cafe on the sixth floor, with wonderful views. We did not have dinner there, but the cafe service was very good. Our room had a large balcony, but the room itself was very compact; though attractive enough. Staying there for two nights, the room felt cramped; more than two nights might be hard to take; even with the wonderful view from the balcony. The bathroom was new, and the compact shower (no tub) worked quite well. A buffet breakfast is served in the ground floor cafe. It is quite adequate, but not memorable. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous. Our room cost seemed somewhat inflated, given the small size of the room. But the view from the balcony more than compensated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views from the Restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: MacDutch
Reviews.Content: We were part of a tour group and our stay here was pretty good for the price. We had the most awesome view in the restaurant, where you could sit inside or outside. You can see over the water, the mosques etc. Just amazing. The rooms were basic but comfortable. The location of this hotel was the best, money machine close by, food stores, restaurants, shops etc. The service was great.

Reviews.Title: “very convinient to walk around safely in the touristic area, even in the night”
Reviews.Author: hayahiro
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel very often before. Last October , I stayed for the first time in a long time since the last stay. It changed very modern and very functional. I and my husband arrived just afternoon, we were very hungry, then one of the hotel-stuff cooked for us exceptioally. It was very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and a hotel that goes out of its way”
Reviews.Author: Danny03
Reviews.Content: A location behind Aya Sophia and beating the lines in the morning for visits to Topkapi, Cisterns etc is an unbeatable combination. Start the mornings with a visit to Sultan Ahmet Mosque and at nigth. It is at its brilliant best under the early morning and late evening suns. To top it all, kebabs and trams are short stroll. Hotel has a friendly staff, Breakfast is excellent. Rooms are a little cramped. There was work going on at a site outside so the first nite was miserable with trucks unloading and backing out. But we moved to another room the next nite. The airport pickup was excellent. I left a bag at the hotel and it was sent by the hotel in a taxi and reached me at the airport well in time before the flight.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,”
Reviews.Author: lcdGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: very comfortable , friendly staff and good service and value

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in turkey”
Reviews.Author: ashjasmine
Reviews.Content: well , the entire experience was very fascinating and great, i just couldnt imagine something more amazing to go through, i think everyone should go for it atleast once in a lifetime, we wil sure have memories for ever,

Reviews.Title: “View and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nouman_Dawer
Reviews.Content: I was staying there alone and was made to feel very comfertable and nothing was too much trouble all staff was very nice and helpfull the rooms are lovely and breakfast was very good i would go back to stay there again for sure good location to get around sightseeing its perfect.The thing which i liked the most was the angle of view which the hotel was giving round the way , which made me felt that i was in Istanbul.......

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: roku1123
Reviews.Content: I have just returned for a 5 day trip to Istanbul and stayed at the And Hotel in the Sultanahmet region. The hotel is just finishing its major renovations and it is wonderfull!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a must try, excellant Ambience, great Food”
Reviews.Author: SyedFarhan
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent choice.the hotel is nice, clean and comfortable rooms. The location is excellent! Walking distance to everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic view.”
Reviews.Author: aprasetyo
Reviews.Content: We arrived 4 hours early before the check-in time. As we were tired, the receptionist kindly provided us with a room for us to stretch our legs, cleanup while waiting for our room to be cleaned. This already was a great first impression. Once our room was ready, the first thing that struck was the majestic view of the Aya Sofia right outside our window. Catch it during sunset or sunrise, whichever you like... it's right there. THe hotel is perfectly situated in the center of all the major attractions of old Istanbul. Walking distance to a tramstop, and right across the street is a convenience store should you need anything (like bottles of water). The room is kept clean although small. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, helpful staff, easy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: bbppbb
Reviews.Content: Our airport pickup waited for us despite a flight delay, all of the staff were exceptionally helpful - making calls on our behalf and answering any questions we had, view from our room over Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque was incredible, big tasty breakfast. The room was pleasant and clean and we had a great experience. A wonderful place to start a visit in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “practical, friendly service, convenient facilities, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: paelinck
Reviews.Content: Practical place to stay. Convenient services. Good facilities. Not far from Blue Mosq, Topkapi, bazaar ecc.. Lobby not very large. International TV stations appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Itje
Reviews.Content: This Hotel located at a very strategic Sultanahmed area, in a walking distance to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, also to hop on-hop off red bus. I was very happy with a personalized service from the Hotel staff. The hotel atmosphere is homy and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: LeoDubai
Reviews.Content: Pros ===== Fantastic location in Sultanahmet area with Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilca Cistern, Grand Bazar within a few minutes of walking. Spice Bazar about 15 mins on foot. Staff helpful & friendly Good Breakfast Rooms though small were quite clean with good heating. Bathrooms were well stocked with good supply of hot water Were able to arrange city tours at a days notice. Book direct at andhotel.com to get best rates Free wi-fi Cons ====== No tea/coffee kettles No English channels on TV, were promised a look by the technician who never arrived in the 5 days that we were there. Rooftop panoramic restaurant under renovation No room service except for Tea/coffee Mini Bars just had water bottles

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LongWaySomewhere
Reviews.Content: The AND Hotel in Istanbul was fabulous, the location was perfect for exploring the city and its sights. The rooms were small but really nice linens and a great view out our window out to the Aya Sophia, very quiet for a big city, staff very helpful and friendly and most important for us was the safety of our motorcycle which we got to park in front of the hotel but out of sight. The Turkish bath we had behind the Blue Mosque was great, the Whirling Dervishes we saw at the Cultural Center was great too and its right across the road from the Sisterns a must see, 5min walk to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia great restaurants and shopping, perfect spot!!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Aya22
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2nights, and it was really awesome experience. the price is not so expensive but the location is totally perfect. we can walk to Ayasofya around 3min and Bluemosque around 5min. Room quarity is wonderful and staff are also friendly. If you would like to visit old city in Istanbul, I really recommend you to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MAbdallah
Reviews.Content: My wife and 1 year old baby stayed at this hotel for 5 days. We had a wonderful time at Istanbul, and this hotel was in the best location, right in the heart of the historic city. Its 2 minutes from Aya Sofia and 4 minutes from SultanAhmet mosque, and right next to the tram station. We booked a panoramic double room, the view was wonderful from the room seeing the side of Aya Sofia. The hotel was clearly just renovated and was spotless. The room was cleaned every day. The room size was just right, with one kind bed and a baby crib. Breakfast was reasonable, breads (Turkish) and cheeses, omelettes, cereal, juices. The top restaurant was still being renovated, so we didn't get a chance to use but we took a peak of the view and it was indeed wonderful. We didn't miss it, and the hotel was just excellent even without it. We would definitely stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect rooms to face beauty”
Reviews.Author: Protasenya
Reviews.Content: We've loved And hotel most of all for their location, but what was very important is that other things (such as service, rooms, cleanliness etc.) were good enough not to spoil it. We consider And hotel to be the perfect place to stay, regardless of your trip's goal. Even if you go for business - believe me, you'll love watching two of the most beautiful mosques of the world before you go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Danyto87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AND hotel 3 nights and did not get a night sleep let alone good night sleep. right outside our room was something which to me looked like a giant aircon unit and it used to come on every few minuts or so even through the night and once that was on, there was no chance of any sleep even for heavy sleeper like me. When I compalined the next morning, they just said they are full and don't have any other rooms. Also, the aircon is controlled centrally so they switch it off at night, so we had to have the windows open due to the heat which made the outside noise even worst. Not sure whoes bright idea it was to put that noisy unit right out side bedrooms, it should have been on the roof, I imagine other rooms on that side of the hotel suffer from the same issue but if you manage to get a room that is not effected by this noisy beast, then this will be a nice hotel (for the price) to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: 88SanLucas
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the And Hotel very much. And hotel is excellent value and has an excellent location. It is within walking distance of many popular sites, loads of restaurants and ready access to public transportation. The rooms are up to date, clean, and there is no noise from outside. The staff is friendly and very helpful. They were able to answer all of our questions and helped us a lot. We recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Evelien1
Reviews.Content: This hotel in a quiet lane in the old town of Istanbul has magnificent views to the Ayasofia, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. Staff were very helpful and the renovated rooms are beautiful (although there was no teamaker in the room). Ask for a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “And hotel is very well situated in the old city ina calm area just near Sultanhamet, Ayasofia and the Kapali Ã§arsi”
Reviews.Author: maharou
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night this time and it was the first time in And Hotel. It was really a pleasant time to rest and to be so near of Sultanhamet I love. I saw the two mosques by the window of my bedroom. I found professional people in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, newly renovated, clean, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: smulhall
Reviews.Content: Very close to the main tourist attractions, great view from the upper floors, Fronts on a quiet side street just off one of the main streets. Front desk staff courteous and helpful. Rooms were newly renovated and clean, but small. We stayed there twice during our Turkey trip. First time in September for 5 nights on third floor, Second time in November for 2 nights on 5th floor (top). Wireless internet connection did not work well on top floor (weak signal). 95 Euros per night. Included breakfast was good, Lots of food with good variety. Roof top bar/restaurant was still under reconstruction but looks like it will be nice when completed.

Reviews.Title: “The location of the hotel is excellent; the service, very good.”
Reviews.Author: acazeneuve
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the historical area of the city. It's a walking distance from the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The tramway station is 200 metres far from the Hotel. It's small and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, great people, great location”
Reviews.Author: Elmas_10
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel and the city itself. The staff were extremely friendly and were of help wherenever we needed them, especially in the breakfast room. It is a clean and very intimate hotel. The room was small but comfortable and well furnished and a nice little balcony to feel the warm nights. I was surprised how very close i was staying many of the main sights. The roof terrace has the grandest views of the Sophia Hagia and the Blue Mosque, it was quite something to experience. Without doubt Aydin was the most gracious and very professional staff that I have met. I am very thankful for his help for me and my two sisters who stayed at the And hotel in the last week of October. I recommend this hotel very highly for your visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerAlex
Reviews.Content: I had been here before and will go there again if I go to Istanbul and the price is reasonable. The hotel is quite good, don't expect five stars, but it isn't bad. The best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Istanbul! Nice, clean and central hotel right in front of Hagia Sophia.”
Reviews.Author: VincenzoCf
Reviews.Content: And Hotel is a great choice for everybody who wants to stay in Sultanhamet and enjoy the closeness of all main historical sites of Istanbul. I was there with my girlfriend in August and had an amazing room with balcony overlooking the hagia sophia and the blue mosque! The rooms are recently renovated and fully equipped with everything you may need. The staff is nice and quite friendly so as the breakfast is ok. I will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “NIce 3 days - would need more”
Reviews.Author: Vanpaul
Reviews.Content: Although the weather was not good it was nice experience - Lot of people - tram full - plenty of life - monuments are great - people are simple -although some of them cheat for some extra money when they find the opportunity - we will come back

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tinkah
Reviews.Content: we liked our stay in And hotel very much. everything was excellent. room was clean and tidy, very nice furnished. everything what we needed, we got, receptionist was very helpful and the breakfast, veeery good - vegetarian. no meat. i did not mind not having sausages for breakfast. Another important think is that there was no noise from outside. Thanks and I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: Tayyaba_Khanam
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul at the end of August and stayed at the And hotel after reading all the feedback people gave about the hotel didn't sound like my holiday would be enjoyable, but when I reached there I was surprised because the hotel just looked as though it was built and I asked one of the receptionist when did you refurbish the hotel and he said two weeks ago. The bedrooms were so nice and so was the rest of the hotel it was only a 5 minute walk away from Blue Mosque, hagia Sophia and many other historical sights and Museums. The area was beautiful and there was also a tram station near the hotel from where you can get on the tram and go to local bazaars and seasides also to Palaces. Also near the hotel there are many restaurants and the food it brilliant also there is McDonalds and many others. Not forgetting near the hotel there is a Church and a few Mosques. This is a Hotel I recommend you should stay at. The breakfast it also very nice and there is a lift in the hotel also not forgetting the workers are very polite and friendly and the receptionist Meryem is very helpful if you want to know what places to visit she will tell you and tell you how to get there. Not forgetting there is also Free Wifi access in the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just like a second home for me.”
Reviews.Author: asiye66
Reviews.Content: First of all the comfort of the hotel was verry good and also the service was amazing. The staff was verry helpfull and most importantly friendly at any time, especially the bellboy named Cemal was superb. We never had any problems and for us it was like staying at a five-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city visit”
Reviews.Author: skibiker46
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had a great experience. Most staff were very friendly and very helpful. Sadly the restaurant was closed so we missed out on that. Breakfast was ok (fruit needs more bananas, oranges etc and less apples!). Our room was refurbed and perfect. Hotel location is perfect for the sites and very quiet. Sadly there is a scriffy empty office block opposite. It is free WiFi which I liked and everywhere was clean and refurbed. I would recommend this. I also use a wheelchair and the hotel and our room was great for me. Peter and Brigitt

Reviews.Title: “Best place to feel the history”
Reviews.Author: Arturd
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the And Hotel. We got very good times. Easly reach main place and metro line. Terace view was great. Free parking and new decoration add relax feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mommyfish3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Clean, comfortable, and very friendly and helpful staff. Location is great, and my room view was unbelievable! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel, great terrace”
Reviews.Author: tci210
Reviews.Content: - nice, friendly staff - great location, you are right in the middle of everything in old Istanbul, stations to public transportation are very close - reliable pick up service from and to the airport - breakfast is nice also (nothing fancy, but still very nice: they have muffins, and freshly baked pastry filled with cottage cheese...) - we liked the afternoon snack at the lobby (biscuits, muffins and coffee) - but I think they have it only on Saturdays (or we missed it on other days :) - reasonable room prices (great value) - rooms are very nice (all white :) - maybe a bit small, but for this price it's ok - rooms have free use of fridge and safe - flat screen tv in the room (not many channels) - towels are changed daily - after renovation this hotel is a perfect place to stay - the surroundings of the hotel could use some renovation :) - the rooms could use some extra lights and shelves - also a few hangers or shelves would be nice in the bathroom - the air conditions outside are a bit loud at night - wireless internet sometimes works and sometimes it doesn't :) - we loved the terrace on the top, unfortunatelly it was still under renovation, so we didn't have breakfast there (which is maybe a good thing, otherwise we would have stayed there the whole day and admire the view :). A great place to come and see the view of old and new Istanbul - we would certainly come back to this hotel

HotelInfo.Name: And Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Yerebatan Cad Cami Cikmazi No:36-40 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
